results.title: Heaven can wait
results.creator_credit: Buck Henry, Warren Beatty and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: At a peak in his career LA Rams quarterback Joe Pendleton (Warren Beatty) is erroneously summoned to heaven by an over-zealous escort (co-director Buck Henry). Mr Jordan, a senior official in heaven, (James Mason) seeks to set things in order by offering Joe a place back on earth in the body of another mortal. After seeing environmental lobbyist Betty Logan (Julie Christie) Joe decides to inhabit the body of Leo Farnsworth, a rich amoral industrialist who is in danger from his murderous wife (Dyan Cannon) and her lover (Charles Grodin). When Joe decides to get Pendleton’s body into shape he engages the services of his old coach in order to do so. This comedy was Warren Beatty’s directorial debut and he has great fun as Pendleton/Farnsworth. A fairly light romantic comedy/fantasy, “Heaven can wait” is a remake of “Here comes Mr Jordan” (1941) and was a big hit in 1978. Winner of one Academy Award in 1979 for Best art direction, the film was nominated for seven others.

results.title: Ground Zero
results.brief_description: Harvey Denton (Colin Friels) is movie cameraman who is plunged into a bewildering series of events when, one night, his flat is viciously ransacked. Someone is after something, but what? Now Trebilcock of ASIO, Australia’s secret service, contacts Harvey with strange news. The body of his father, a documentary filmmaker, missing since Harvey was a boy, has been found in the desert outback, buried inside a thirty year old plane wreck and the wreck is discovered to be radioactive.

results.title: The Way of the dragon = Return of the dragon
results.creator_credit: Bruce Lee, Raymond Chow and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Tang Lung travels to Rome to help save a family friend’s restaurant which is being threatened by a powerful gang boss. Initially seen as an embarrassment amongst his Chinese friends, Tang Lung is soon held in high esteem when he reveals his masterful martial arts skills defending the restaurant against the thugs. The gang boss begins a number of attacks on the restaurant in an effort to defeat Tang Lung. He finally flies in an American martial arts assassin to challenge Tang Lung to fight to the death. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Nora Miao and Chuck Norris. Dubbed into English.

results.title: Johnny got his gun
results.brief_description: This is the ultimate anti-war film by writer/director Dalton Trumbo. The setting is World War I and a nameless, armless, legless, faceless hospitalised soldier is found to be conscious despite the extreme condition that his body remains in after an explosion. His isolation and freakish state causes unease and anguish to the viewer. The horror that he faces is broken up through the film with flashbacks of the soldiers life before the war. “Johnny Got his Gun” is a very important film which is both thought-provoking and distressing. Trumbo received the 1971 Fipresci Prize and was nominated for the Golden Palm at Cannes. Cast includes Timothy Bottoms, Jason Robards, Donald Sutherland, David Soul and Diane Varsi.

results.title: In my father's den
results.creator_credit: Brad McGann, Dixie Linder, Trevor Haysom, New Zealand Film Commission and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: Tinged with a sense of foreboding and mystery not unlike the landscapes in which the film is set, “In my father’s den” is a mix of coming-of-age story and murder mystery. Paul (British actor Paul MacFadyen), a war photographer, returns to his isolated hometown in New Zealand for his father’s funeral. He left the town when his mother committed suicide and his brother (Colin Moy), who remained behind, does not welcome his return warmly. Staying on for a longer time that he anticipated, Paul starts a friendship with his ex-girlfriend’s illegitimate 16-year-old daughter Celia (Emily Barclay). Celia is a typical angst-ridden teenager with a sharp mind and yearning to explore the wider world - not unlike Paul in his youth. When Celia disappears, Paul becomes the main suspect and the town turns against him. An adaptation of Maurice Gee’s novel of the same name, first time feature writer/director Brad McGann has created a cinematic treat, building unspoken tensions and fears as the story unfolds. Cast includes Miranda Otto.

results.title: Mr Magoo
results.creator_credit: Stanley Tong, Ben Myron and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Mr. Magoo becomes the target of a notorious and ruthless band of international jewel thieves when he sets out to retrieve a stolen gem. Features: Leslie Nielsen, Kelly Lynch, and Malcolm McDowell.

results.title: Georgia
results.creator_credit: Ulu Grosbard, Barbara Turner, Jennifer Jason Leigh, CiBy 2000 and Georgia Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Sadie is an ambitious singer of limited talent, whose dependence on alcohol and drugs wreaks havoc within her life and on her interpersonal relationships, particularly with her sister, Georgia, whose happy marriage and thriving music career, principally in country and western, contrasts with Sadie’s incessant struggle. Ulu Grosbard’s film (originally slated to be directed by Robert Altman) is a raw and affecting portrait of a woman, whose ambition and lust for life is compromised by addictions and a self destructive nature, compounded by living in the shadow of her urbane and successful sister. The contrast between the sisters is constantly driven home by the inter-cutting of their parallel lives - Georgia is well dressed, orderly, mannered, emotionally controlled, living in a pristine country home, in a safe, assured, if passionless, existence; Sadie is slovenly, emotional, irrational, psychologically raw and barren, drifting between filthy abodes and unsavoury friends. A powerful examination of sibling dynamics, “Georgia” is challenging in its brutal evocation of the destructive impulses and unfortunate circumstances that underscore life’s many inequities. Mare Winnginham was nominated for Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her performance in the title role.

results.title: La Spagnola
results.creator_credit: Steve Jacobs, Anna-Maria Monticelli, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent and Wild Strawberries
results.brief_description: Directed by Steve Jacobs and set in 1960, “La Spagnola” is one family’s story of the migrant experience in Australia. Lola (Lola Marceli) is a beautiful, tempestuous Spanish woman living in a remote industrial town with her boorish husband, Ricardo (Simon Palomares), and their teenage daughter, Lucia (Alice Ansara). When Ricardo decides to leave her for his Australian mistress, Lola is left destitute and pregnant turns violent and vengeful. Her daughter, sensitive, lonely, mocked at school, and confused by her mother’s anger toward her, seeks refuge in an aunt and tries to reconcile with her absent father. Lola is driven by a quest for revenge against the two who have robbed her of her only security in a strange land. Lola and Lucia, each striking out hatefully at the other, are on a collision course, plotting their separate plans for vengeance. Also starring Alex Dimitriades as a local playboy, romantically interested in both mother and daughter. Mostly in Spanish, with Italian and English, and with English subtitles.

results.title: Honeymoon in Vegas (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Bergman, Mike Lobell, Castle Rock Entertainment and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Nicholas Cage is Jack Singer, a second-rate private eye who has somehow managed to win the undying love of gorgeous school teacher, Betsy Nolan (Sarah Jessica Parker). Now, after 5 years Betsy wants a commitment, but Jack is plagued by his mother’s deathbed wish that he never marry. In an irrational moment Jack relents and they travel to Vegas to exchange their vows, and this is where the trouble begins. Featuring James Caan as a wealthy, evil card-shark and a cast including several-hundred Elvis impersonators, it’s a hunka hunka burnin’ fun!
